title: Lost 9/10 placement matches and it puts me in Silver III
body: I feel like I'm losing 75% of normals after a long time of being away from league... my hidden MMR too high for my skill so I reckon I'll do ranked and play around in Bronze with people my own skill level. After a harrowing 9 losses in 10 games it puts me in Silver III.  I just wanna come home from work and play a game of league without getting brutalized. It feels like my account is ruined and I have to make a smurf (with none of the skins and champions)

replies.body:
According to op.gg,  Your MMR is quite a bit higher than average. 1,443 MMR
A baseline MMR has been changed by the latest Riot patch. (2016/2/20)
The Average MMR for this league is 1,309.

This is why you still placed in Silver III. So tell me, how did you improve your MMR so much since you were Silver 3 in Season 4? Did you transfer to OCE from another server or something? Or do normals affect your placement MMR?

Well, you have two options: play normals for fun after work. Or keep playing ranked, you'll be bronze in no time. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} 

But really, silver is the new bronze, so I wouldn't worry about your rank at all. Imagine if you'd won 5/10 placement matches and made Gold or something!

I won 9 out of 10. You know what I got for my efforts. Goddamn Silver 4.

What in the hell is that.
6 wins 4 losses and it puts me in Bronze 2 WTF riot{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
Well it hit me too. I was literaly (but unintentional) feeding. lost 10 games - still silver 3:O rito

bruh everyone thinks its how much wins u get,well its not. have u ever noticed that when ur say gold 2 u always get silver 3? or silver 1 and get b5? because it almost all the time. the wins and losses change how much lp u earn by making elo or mmr differ. basically
Update: Silver III is fine for me I found out after playing some games after placement. Won 4 out of 5 games. Butthurt has a salve on it.

@ Main Line: I don't think I ever made it to Gold in my League career when I took it a lot more seriously with my friends. My mechanical skill has never been up there, I just sort of get carried through games on good map awareness. Normals are okayish but (I feel like I lose a hell of a lot more than I win).

The placement matches however felt like a farce. 1st I picked 'Fill' for all 10 matches and naturally was assigned Support. 5 of those games were a multi lane stomp that snowballed out of control before the laning phase even finished up. 4 of those games (I felt) were lost because I was a shitty support. The whole placement process felt gross and unfair. AND THEN to be placed so high. Like wtf.

Edit: Question- does normal play effect ranked play??
I can't believe what I'm reading haha, never seen a post like this before
